website_summaries.verdict: Safe to use on any wooden products in the kitchen for a good delivery of restoration.
pros: Use this on wood utensils, cutting boards, or bowls to protect the material from water absorption
Made in America, so you can trust the safety of the materials
cons: Some quality control issues with damaged bottle caps and broken seals

customer_reviews.title: Protect your cutting boards with this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience using mineral oil for a cutting board. I had always used a bit of mild soap and water, which I now know is damaging to the wood over time. I just purchased a John Boos butcher block kitchen island. It's beautiful, and it's a focal point in my kitchen, so I want to keep it properly maintained. I went online to research different mineral oils, and decided to give Cutting Board's product a try. I am very pleased with their product and will continue to use it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and simple clean-up
customer_reviews.text: I received a new bamboo cheese board for Christmas and wanted to protect the wood. Found this Food Grade Mineral oil and applied several coats over a 4-5 day period. This product was perfect for the job. It has protected the wood and in fact looks better with this treatment. Yes it’s an oil you need to apply and I tried paper towel which worked but I felt that by using my bare fingers I could feel and rub the oil in better. Cleaning my hands was simple. So far, I’m very happy with this product and very happy to have it on hand for future treatments. This bottle goes a long way!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Mullan

customer_reviews.title: Brings Butcher Block Back to LIFE!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had been neglecting my butcher block island. I found this Food Grade Mineral Oil and applied a generous coat - I was amazed at how it brought the island back to life. I gives a lovely coat to the island and the fact that it is food grade is imperative. It went on easily and looks remarkable. As I mentioned, it truly brought the island back to life. I got two bottles so I could more regularly maintain my block! Thank you for producing such a fabulous oil!!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Food Grade Mineral Oil for Cutting Boards
customer_reviews.text: This is great for getting a new cutting board ready to use and for follow-ups every once in a while. The new board was given to me and I thought before using it I better get it ready. I had an old board this someone give me that had never been seasoned. That was what made me ask for a new one for Christmas. I got started on it right away. Now I use the oil after I clean the board after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Martie

customer_reviews.title: Removes waterproof mascara
customer_reviews.text: I use mineral oil to take off my makeup, including waterproof mascara and waterproof eyebrow shaped. I’ve used many other types of makeup remover products and this is by far the best for my skin type. I have very sensitive and dry skin. I patch tested this product first to make sure I didn’t react negatively. As with anything in life, your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend the Food Grade Mineral Oil
customer_reviews.text: I was very thankful to find a food grade oil to use on my new bamboo cutting boards and equally as thankful for the reasonable price. I have three cutting boards and after oiling all of them was surprised at how little of the oil was required to cover them front and back so not only was the product good and the price reasonable, but this bottle will last for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: wfc

customer_reviews.title: A little bit goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. There are many factors that affect the quality of a cutting board but a good coating of mineral oil is the most important piece in protecting that quality. We have mostly used glass and composite cutting boards in the past due to discoloration and "drying out" of older wooden cutting boards. We were recently given a large wooden cutting board than needed a little TLC. After a little light sanding, we applied a little Thirteen Chefs Food Grade Mineral oil to the board. This thing is beautiful and is now usable and protected. As stated in the headline, A little bit goes a long way. This bottle should last me a year.
customer_reviews.author: S Mendow

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased! I treated 5 cutting boards, 2 large, 1 medium, 2 small, plus 2 spoons and they look and feel fantastic. I wish I had a before photo to show how pale and dry they were. I applied several coats to both sides and the edges and still have 3/4 of the bottle left! The directions say to spread the oil with a knife but I wore a dish glove and used my hand. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pennywise

customer_reviews.title: I have used the product and like the way it has made my wooden products look ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the product and like the way it has made my wooden products look and keep them useful. However, my bottle was opened and some oil leaked all over the packaging. it seems the safety cover on the bottle came loose and the lid unscrewed. not a big problem as I still had quite a bit left in bottle. packaging may need to be tweaked a bit. Thank you, Tina
customer_reviews.author: twiggerooh

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I know there is not really much one can say about mineral oil. I can tell you that I have many wooden bowls and decorative items in my house made of wood including wood spoons I use daily cooking. They have all come back to life. I actually bought this to season a new bamboo cutting board Btothers and got on a kick of oiling every bit of wood in the house with it. If you choose another brand make sure it is food grade. This product is an inexpensive way to make your life a bit more shiny. I want add that it got here faster than expected.
customer_reviews.author: ClareBear

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I received the mineral oil in the mail today. After I opened the package and took the bottle out, I noticed dirt and air pockets under the transparent lable. Also the lid was loose. Thankfully the safety seal was secured and did not leak. I am not rating the oil , but how the product was packaged. For a package containing food grade material, and finding dirt under the lable makes me question how clean the bottling process is. I picture someone buying a barrel of oil and transferring/packaging it in their dirty garage. I will return this product and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Deen

customer_reviews.title: Easily absorbed w/o residue
customer_reviews.text: The best mineral oil I’ve ever used. It absorbs easily on a clean cutting board or butcher block. Our block is built in and I wasn’t 100% sure it was taken care of before us. After a few months of cleaning and oiling with a different mineral oil that left a thick layer of film I found this stuff. It’s been amazing, after one overnight use the wood looked and felt smooth and refreshed. It doesn’t keep the food oders like it used too, which is always a wonderful improvement
customer_reviews.author: Elena Schwam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been bad..I put my wooden spoons in the dishwasher. Ugh! Anyway..looked up ways to revive my Spoons. Found this amazing product!!! Food grade mineral oil is absolutely what I needed!!! It did everything its suppose to do plus it's safe to use!! Granted my Spoons needed a second application but I expected that!! Thank you for an amazing product!! I'll purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love this oil. We use it on many wooden surfaces that come into contact with food. I also use it on knife blades that need to be re-mineralized. How do you know if your blade needs to be re-mineralize? If you are asking the question, that is a pretty good indication that it needs to be done. Because this oil is just the right weight, it penetrates well and doesn't leave the kind of grease that attracts dirt. You still have to wipe it up/in with a clean rag, but it is really simple and effective. I always have a couple bottles in the closet; it is just that handy.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: I've used it on my bamboo dish rack and butcher block also with great success. After a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has worked out really well. I've just inherited some very old wooden utensils that look healthy again after using this oil on them. I've used it on my bamboo dish rack and butcher block also with great success. After a few weeks, I haven't noticed anything to be concerned about, and in fact everything still looks like I'd just oiled them. Considering the price in addition to all of this - I'd say it's a pretty perfect buy.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Bought as an experiment
customer_reviews.text: While I DO have butcher blocks and cutting boards, I primarily bought this to coat some knife blades that are very expensive, but not stainless although stainless WILL rust, lots of people dont know this, so its getting used on ALL my good knives. It hasnt been long enough to tell if it works and I would be glad to update this in the not so distant future. I liked the speed with which it was delivered, the packaging of the product, everything looks great, just havent tested the performance. Good luck to you guys and your company! Pete
customer_reviews.author: Rogue Blackheart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent barrier
customer_reviews.text: We bought this primarily to coat our sauerkraut packer but we liked it so much we've used it on our cutting boards as well. It forms a really good barrier to keep whatever wood utensil/cutting board you put it on well protected. Does not have much of a scent, so you don't have to worry about your food picking up any taste or odor from it. I make wooden toys and I'm going to try it on some of them since it isn't harmful if the grandkids happen to "taste" the toy. A very good product we are very happy with. Will buy again when needed without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: JcM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Oil For Reviving Wooden Utensils
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to wooden cooking utensils and was looking for something to help maintain their appearance. Your mineral oil not only does the trick, but is food safe. One of my favorite cooking utensils is a Bloodwood Spatula. I use that spatula to cook just about everything. After a weeks worth of cooking and washing, it starts to fade, so I just add a few drops of your mineral oil, rub it in, and WALLAH ... I get that fresh, out of the box appearance my spatula had when it arrived from the manufacturer. Not only would I purchase this item again, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leatherwood, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Soapstone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my counter top soapstone. If have tried many products and liked many. All had their pluses and minuses. But I like this one especially because it is simple and leaves the surface clean, consistent and good looking. And, only a drop or two goes a long way. I would definitely buy it again, and I am sure will.
customer_reviews.author: Straight_Talk

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I am not a long-time cutting board user but I purchased this oil to use on my recently purchased board. I can appreciate that this mineral oil "exceeds the standards for direct and indirect food contact set forth by the FDA." That quote comes from the bottle. Also the bottle contains clear and easy-to-follow tips to best use the oil. I am holding the bottle now because I am writing this review and I plan to try the "chef's tip" for applying oil later today. I do believe this product will help to preserve the quality and durability of the cutting board. Plus it can also be used on wooden "salad bowls, utensils, furniture and more."
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaT

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I have a new cutting board and needed to get it read for use. I followed the included instructions for new boards and I can't be happier. Very nice! **note - I did receive a nice note from the seller after purchase. I looked into their small company and I'm impressed with their products. I'll look for them when I have any cutting board related needs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Don Quixote

customer_reviews.title: Make things look great again!
customer_reviews.text: I rated scent a 5 because I couldn’t tell that it had a scent. So far I’ve used it on 2 stainless steel sinks and on a new quartz countertop. As reviews have said, a little goes a long way. It made the sinks look great but to my surprise it made the new quartz top look great also. On the quartz it made the colors more vivid with a glossy look. I’d certainly recommend this and will buy again. The more I use this mineral oil, the more I like it. I’d include it with vinegar and duck tape as a household essential.
customer_reviews.author: SAK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but takes a little bit longer than expected to dry
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on new and old cutting boards, I noticed that on the new boards I will need to oil them again as mentioned in the instructions, the older boards look like they will be OK for awhile. I like that it is made in the USA and so far I am happy with it. I use it when I can leave the boards out to dry overnight.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff, it goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 different bamboo cutting boards of different sizes and thickness. EACH one NEEDED to be oiled. Each one sucked this oil in easily. As per all the instructions online, they state you will need to give your bamboo boards several oil coatings. This is true (I learned). This oils works amazingly and gets absorbed very quickly into each board. I also have a very thick pro board and gave it more oil. This is great and I will buy again. And a little really DOES go a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Keith in VA

customer_reviews.title: Food Grade Mineral Oil
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Applied to new bamboo cutting board and it really did a nice job. Applied liberally and let stand overnight, wiped off any excess in morning. Cutting board looks great and performs very nicely. Highly recommend. Easy to follow directions and excellent follow-up. Y seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months now. This board oil is easy to use and I love how my wood items have almost life brought back to them. I have used it on a dough board, wood handled cooking utensils and even my Pioneer Woman spice box. The oil rubs in easily and no greasy after feel (when following the directions properly). When I need to treat my wood items, I use it the night before and everything is great by morning! Highly recommend and will reorder when I start running low.
customer_reviews.author: sapphirerosebud

customer_reviews.title: Proper care for wood cooking items
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a cutting board that I was giving as a gift. While I was treating the cutting board with the "Food Grade Mineral Oil" I decided to also treat the old wooden spoon that was starting to look bad. I was delighted with the end product. Of course the cutting board was really nice but the wooden spoon looked like new. I am keeping this bottle of "Food Grade Mineral" and order another one for the individual who received the cutting board.
customer_reviews.author: MJA

customer_reviews.title: Mineral oil on wooden cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the mineral oil to use on our wooden cutting boards. As great as the product is as far as water resistance and NO scent (which I love) a little goes a LONG way. We learned this the hard way. My husband used some on the handle of a wooden knife and he definitely went a bit overboard and it began rubbing off on everything it came in contact with. This was done by our error, just wanted to let others know so they are careful; especially those that are heavy handed. But we will definitely be purchasing it again once we run out of the one we purchased! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Good Product But Arrived With At Least 1 Ounce Leaked Out of Bottle...
customer_reviews.text: This product is so easy to use since in my case, it started working on my new cutting board before I had a chance to open the box. The mineral oil works fine, but my shipment arrived with a loose cap and about one ounce spilled over the maple cutting board that was shipped along with it. And the protective inner seal was still intact when I unscrewed the cap. But at least I got a head start at oiling-up and conditioning my new cutting board.
customer_reviews.author: russbooker

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to oil a new cutting board I purchased last November. Took me a while to get around to actually oiling the board. Very happy I finally did since I wouldn't use the cutting board until I took care of it. The oil took a very long time to dry between coats. When I finally put on the 3rd coat I set the board aside and gave it all the time it needed to dry completely. Now the board is my favorite to use. the mineral oil gave the pale and dry-looking cutting board a rich and vibrant color and it was a joy to use. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: pls.hutter

customer_reviews.title: All around great oil for cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mineral oil for cutting boards. I let my bamboo cutting board oiling lapse for a few months and it lost its sheen. After two wipe downs the luster has been restored and its water resistant once again. This oil has no taste or smell to it. (Yeah, I tasted it, big whoop). Pro tip: oil your cutting boards once a month. I give this product five stars because when it comes time to reorder I will purchase this again and not look for alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. McKenzieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I read the reviews & purchased this mineral oil from thirteen chefs. This mineral oil is great. I originally brought it to use on the blades of my cordless shaver to preserve it longer. After my 1st use, I was happy with my purchase. It did not clogged the blades & using it on my skin did not leave it oily, matter of fact it made shaving more easier & smoother on my skin. Keep making great products. I will definitely buy from Thirteen Chefs again.
customer_reviews.author: Peace29

customer_reviews.title: Protects my cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: I've never really used mineral oils on my cutting board and I'm not sure whether it's to protect the wood or keep contaminants from the woods' pores. It was an instruction on the label of my new huge cutting board, so I perused Amazon and found this that will ship immediately with good reviews. I did as instructed on my new board and it still looks new. It was easy to apply and it dried as it said on the instruction. I also used it on my old cutting board and it wiped away the scratch and cut marks.
customer_reviews.author: Nino C. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF
customer_reviews.text: Price is a RIP off. Go to grocery store for food grade mineral oil
customer_reviews.author: Jane Shulsen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our new kitchen island with a butcher block top. The surface was not in great shape so I figured I’d give this a shot. Spread a heavy coat on the butcher block and let it soak in overnight. Wiped the excess off with a paper towel and that was it. Incredibly easy with nice results. I touch it up now and then with a little oil on a paper towel. Couldn’t be easier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works Good on Knife Strop
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to use a food grade mineral oil to load knife strop, and it worked very well. It soaked into the leather very well and has not required a reapplication for quite a long time. I am not a knife strop expert... Not sure if food grade mineral oil is the way to go, or, if it really matters. But, this oil made the leather perfect (in my mind) for sharpening knives. Razor sharp knife gives this oil 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: T Bunk

customer_reviews.title: Smoooooth
customer_reviews.text: Smooth as butta. This was the first time I bought this particular brand, and I am very happy with it. Not only did it work nicely on my chopping block, but it helped to restore a wooden spoon that my *ahem* wife left soaking in a cup of water... :). I can highly recommend this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: PdXgEm725

customer_reviews.title: Mineral Oil for my Bamboo Cutting Block
customer_reviews.text: Bought a nice Bamboo cutting board and wanted some mineral oil to use on the cutting board. This was easy to order with the cutting board and was great to use on the board prior to use. Using a few drops I could easily cover the 17-inch cutting board. Little to no smell and so easy to use. Maybe a bit more expensive than I wanted but it gets the job done without using a bunch of the oil. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CODJ2013

customer_reviews.title: Replenishes & Soaks in Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! I bought Thirteen Chefs mineral oil to use on my bamboo pizza peel because the "wood butter" I have for cutting boards doesn't seem to soak into bamboo. This mineral oil is so great, I've thrown out the nut butter & will only use the oil from now on. It's clean, easy to control & spread, does not smell like perfume & soaks in so nicely, within just a couple hours, wood is replenished, feels & looks healthy and ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: ... I received it to see if it worked as good as everyone had said
customer_reviews.text: I used this oil right away after I received it to see if it worked as good as everyone had said. And it did !! I have a large cutting board that has to be at least 15 years old and I can't remember the last time I treated it. Now it looks brand new. Love the stuff.
customer_reviews.author: TammyZ

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself money. Go to your local Walgreens or Walmart and buy reg mineral oil
customer_reviews.text: A huge bust! The density of water. Zero scent- which I’m pretty sure it’s supposed to be, I don’t remember. Did not spread well at all. Once again, this is another item I purchased with false information and miss representation. I attempted using it on a cutting board that was new to Coat—There is no opening for a tiny spout, I had to remove cap Completely. It pours like water.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Mctigue

customer_reviews.title: You can use many alternative oils at liwer prices
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to compare results with my own mix of oils that I found online. Similar results with one difference, price. 4 star only bcoz u can make it at home cheaper. Otherwise fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Arash

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing on cutting boards etc during extreme disinfecting. USA Product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this oil! During this COVID-19 disinfecting storm, I have been treating my custom cutting boards and countertops etc. with 70%alcohol at the end of each day. As you’d expect this completely dried out my boards. After applying this oil, they look brand new again! So now they still get the alcohol spray, but it is followed by a good rubdown with this oil. They look amazing! Bonus is that this is a USA product! So excited! I will be using this oil on all my wood kitchen products with complete confidence! Thank you for an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: This food grade mineral oil is easy to use and the wood really appreciates the application. I have a cutting board that has been with me more than 30 years. It was so dry, that it was light colored as well as light weight. I applied this product, as instructed on the container, the cutting board immediately soaked up the oil and asked for more. The colors of the wood became vibrant and the wood is cherry; I did not know this.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Reitz

customer_reviews.title: Nice food oil for olive wood salad bowl
customer_reviews.text: Photos are of 2 different bowls but the dullness was similar. I had time and coated my new olive wood salad bowl from Pottery Barn with Cutting Board Mineral Oil then set on foil and repeated 3-4 nights to reach this finish. Pleasant enough to use. About a Tbsp first then less each night rubbing using my fingers. I have not used to eat from yet. Will update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Neptunebch

customer_reviews.title: Thirteen Chefs Food Grade Mineral Oil
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Thirteen Chefs Food Grade Mineral Oil for oiling my wood cutting boards and new wooden rolling pin. I've just recently tried it. The rolling pin was very dry so, I have applied several applications over the course of a few days. It seems to be a great value on Amazon compared to other food grade mineral oils. It is the consistency that you'd expect (similar to baby oil) and has almost no detectable odor. I'm thinking confidently that this will remain odor free and will not turn rancid on my wooden implements and surfaces. If, after time, it continues to do what I expect it to, I will be a repeat customer.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2Shop

customer_reviews.title: Brings dull counters back to life!
customer_reviews.text: So we bought this stuff for our butcher block countertops and it works so good at removing water spots. We had a lot of them after family came to visit for thanksgiving and I just put this on a cloth and wiped down the counters. It brings it right back to life and leaves a beautiful shine. Highly recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: I made a couple cutting boards and charcuterie boards from some wild cherry boards that were from my family farm. No stain, no varnish, and the mineral oils made them look amazing. It pulled the grains and the saw marks out along with adding a nice honey color to the board. Exactly what I was looking for. I have added a couple pictures of my boards.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good Oil for Cutting Boards and other wood serving pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is a good oil for all wooden items, which will be in contact with food. I use it on cutting boards, wooden bowls, wooden serving platters, etc. After using the item, I gently rinse it under cool water, using my hands to brush off any remaining food. After drying it, I spray this oil on, rubbing it so all surfaces are covered, and leave it on until the next time I use the item. Wood gets dry so quickly, I have found this to help the wood from drying out.
customer_reviews.author: SC Girl

customer_reviews.title: and they came out much better than new after a judicious application of this product
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure there is a substantial difference between various food safe mineral oils, but this one works perfectly well, and the dispensing nozzle lets out jut the right amount. I had been neglecting my wood boards for quite some time, and they came out much better than new after a judicious application of this product; I did let it soak in for most of the day before wiping away any small excess. Your cutting boards will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: gladpal8

customer_reviews.title: Mineral oil to preserve wood cutting board
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my new and an old wood cutting boards as recommended by the maker of my new board. It looks to preserve the wood and the old board looks new again after using this mineral oil. I'll be better at treating the boards after seeing how easy it is to apply and how much better they look. And made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I made a cheese board. I am a hobby woodworker who just likes to make things at random. I needed a cheese board, I had a nice piece of wood... I made a cheese board. I needed something to finish off the wood and this worked great. It really brought out the beautiful nature of the wood without taking away the natural feel. Direction for use were nice. Overall, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brought my great-grandmother's cutting board back to life!
customer_reviews.text: My great-grandmother's old wood cutting board was passed down to me. Its almost 2 inches thick and scared with generations of use. Not knowing better, I let it get dried out and it developed a couple cracks and warped so that it was no longer a flat surface to cut on. Gave it a good drenching with this mineral oil, let it soak in over night, flipped the board and repeated on the other side. The board flattened out and looks like it used too and Im able to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: IveGotSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Use for my butcher block counter tops...love it!
customer_reviews.text: Addicted! So we decided to use butcher block counter tops throughout our kitchen - and love the look. But, they do require maintenance and this product is great to use. Any water stains or hot rings from our coffee mugs, etc...I rub a little of this in and it absorbs into the wood without being too greasy. Would absolutely recommend for your counters.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a wood board before. When I learned that I would need to use mineral oil on my board, I was unsure of which brand to purchase. I am glad that I chose this one. I appreciate that this product does not have a scent, spreads well across the wood board, and is easy to clean off my hands. The wood absorbed the oil with no residue left behind. I will be purchasing this again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. E.

customer_reviews.title: The price is right and it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this oil once but plan to use it monthly on my new cutting board. It was easy to apply with a paper towel. After applying I let the wood absorb the oil overnight and then wiped it dry. It has a clean fresh scent and keeps my cutting board looking new. I recommend this oil to anyone who wants to protect and lengthen the life of their cutting boards. And, keep them looking good at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Del G. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My (pretty expensive catskill) cutting block had never been treated and the color of the wood looked dry and dull. I applied the mineral oil generously and let it sit for a day, then turned the block and did the other side. I have to say, my cutting block looks like NEW!!! I can absolutely recommend this product! So glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele McGadden

customer_reviews.title: Good for the kitchen and for crafting
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this for resin crafting (for filling shaker charms). However, my partner is a professional chef and he uses this for his knives and cutting boards. There's no smell, the squeeze bottle is convenient, and it's crystal clear. I highly reccomend it for the chef or resin crafter in your life. (A note for the resin crafters: I got this bottle and then squeezed it into precision tip bottles for filling charms).
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: After sanding my two cutting boards w/ 220 grit, several applications of this mineral oil were applied. The wood really sucked it up, but am using the two boards again and we can tell the difference. New fluids and food particles can be easily washed off. I did find that the most efficient way to spread the oil on the boards is just by hand. The instructions suggest using a knife. I suppose that would work, but there is no substitute for the dexterity and suppleness of the human hand.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure of any scent in this, so it must not be offensive. As for water resistance, I haven't tested for that. I'm using this for my new hobby of carving wooden utensils. Have just applied the first coating, letting the wood absorb the oil before applying the second treatment. Very easy to use and may have more comments after using the utensils.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: We have a large wood cutting board that desperately needed mineral oil. It hadn't been oiled since we bought it almost 5 years ago & had been washed regularly. It was looking very rough. This product worked AMAZING! No scent to it & I didn't have to use a lot (which I was worried about). All over an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Great way to maintain wood cutting boards and knife handles
customer_reviews.text: I have used vegetable oil in the past to maintain my wooden cutting boards and knife handles, but worried about the oil spoiling after a while. Based on Amazon reviews, I decided to try this mineral oil product from Thirteen Chefs and am very glad that I did. Amazon delivered the product very promptly and I used it right away. Just a few drops keep my cutting boards and knife handles looking great. I am very happy with my purchase and will buy more once I run out.
customer_reviews.author: mr

customer_reviews.title: One bottle and it treated two large cutting boards and a large pizza peel.
customer_reviews.text: Our cutting boards and pizza peel had not been treated before. One board and the peel had been used many times for years. This oil was absorbed easily. We poured the oil in a large plastic sealed bag and let each piece soak for 24 hours. They each look beautiful with the well used pieces looking like new. Even after three pieces there was enough oil left for more. we purchased two bottles and look forward to keeping our wood products properly lubricated.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: The answer to ills!
customer_reviews.text: I purchases this product to use on the leftover pieces of our butcher block counters that were not finished. I first used it to repair a burn mark on an older block. A quick sand to remove the burn, then a dose of this and you would never know there was once a burn mark. Will definitely keep this on hand to keep our counters beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Marie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mineral Oil
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Makes my cutting boards and wood handled knives look fabulous. Left on my aged and care-neglected Boos cutting board to soak in overnight. In the morning found the oil had been completely absorbed and the board looked better than ever. Then used on my other cutting boards with the same results. But better yet...I had bought a set of knives with wood handles thinking that they would look great in my kitchen. Which they did until they started to fade. I rubbed the wood handles with the mineral oil and now they look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen should have this!
customer_reviews.text: I never realized I should be treating my wood kitchen surfaces with mineral oil. It started with a wood fruit bowl that had gotten old and in need of cleaning. When I read about how best to clean a wooden bowl, I learned about the need to treat with oil, and then learned I should be doing this with all my wood cutting boards and the butcher block section of our counter. I am so pleased with how much better the wood looks and cleans up after having been treated.
customer_reviews.author: PedalinMama

customer_reviews.title: First time using food grade mineral oil and love it!
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a teak wood cutting board, which came with 13 Chef's food grade mineral oil. We started oiling our board after a couple of uses/washes and have been loving this stuff. It gives the board a finish and shine that looks professional. There is no scent and no residual. We let the oil seep in for a few hours and then wipe the surface dry with paper towel before the next use. We even oiled our old board so it can be used for cutting raw meats/seafood. So glad we purchased this product, which breathes life into our cutting boards!
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than previous products that I have used! So much lighter in texture!! My EXPENSIVE wooden salad bowl and tossers looks beautiful again!
customer_reviews.author: Miss T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic item. My cutting board looks better than new.
customer_reviews.text: I had a brand new wooden cutting board that was dried out. The first time I used the board my knife left deep gouges. After reconditioning my board with the mineral oil my board looks better than when I bought it. It seems to have also water proofed it somewhat. I cut clean wet vegetables on it all the time and the water pools instead if absorbing. I spread the oil with my hand and let sit for 24 hours before using. I did this twice for a total of 48 hours. I would recommend this item if you are trying to restore wood.
customer_reviews.author: Nan Feld

customer_reviews.title: Great mineral oil!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for some antique furniture I recently pulled out of storage , assuming “food grade” was the most gentle. It worked great, soaking in and leaving no residue, just shine! A little went a long way and there is no fragrance. I would order it again and recommend it to others! Plus, I’m always happy to support a small business!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a cutting board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a fairly expensive cutting board we received as a present. After I used the board, washed with soap and water and let dry, I put a generous amount on the board. It made the small cuts in the surface less noticeable and rest of the board doesn't feel as rough. It also brought out the colors of the wood grain and the board looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Living Large

customer_reviews.title: cutting board restoration
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved in with my girlfriend and when I started cooking in the kitchen, I found these dried out chunks of driftwood. I thought they were lost to time. But then I decided your products and I was amazed at what happened. It took about 4 days to keep reapplying the mineral oil and the board kept soaking it up. After it was done sipping on the wonderful mineral oil, the board came back to like. It looks absolutely beautiful now. I also used the wax to help keep it that way. Thanks for a wonderful product!!
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for seasoning a cutting board
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new Acacia cutting board. We used the 13 chefs mineral oil to season it. We oiled the board and let it sit for an hour or so. We wiped the board down and the oil brought out the beautiful wood grain. It also keeps the board water resistant as well. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Blakeney

customer_reviews.title: The perfect restorative for your neglected and abused cutting board.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to restore our wooden (pig) cutting board, which has not been oiled in a decade or two and was looking mighty dry. I applied the oil liberally to one side and allowed it to seep in for 24 hours. WOW, what a difference. The board soaked up all the oil and looks brand new. I flipped it over and repeated the process on the opposite side with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Szekeres

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my cutting boards and it worked great! They were cutting boards made by my two sons when they were in high school, they are both in their late 40s now. Both boards came out beautifully. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Should be called Minerific oil!
customer_reviews.text: Its great. I use it on the cutting boards to keep them in good condition. I have about 4 really nice cutting boards that I keep out on my couters and this keeps them looking great and not warped. Pro tip if you happen to warp a cutting board after water exposure. You can usually sink it in a tub of mineral oil overnight and it will usually fix its self. This stuff is great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I have butcher block countertops and was looking for an oil that could refresh them monthly. This product worked great. It doesn't have an unpleasant odor and was easily absorbed by the countertops. Left them with a nice finish. I will continue to use this monthly to keep my countertops and cutting boards in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Bookwormish Me

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and size is more than enough
customer_reviews.text: Mineral oil is pretty straight forward in how to use. You really don't need to use much so this bottle size is completely sufficient. There's not really a scent but that's really what you want for your cutting board. Wouldn't want that to get into your food. For me I just use a simple paper towel to spread a bit of the oil every month or so on my cutting board and let it sit usually overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Ginar

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable?!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't do what I needed it to do - and it didn't say it wasn't returnable - how is that possible when it's listed under Amazon Prime...?
customer_reviews.author: Moirraine

customer_reviews.title: great improvement on cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: I was greatly pleased on my two cutting boards, one over 40 yrs. old one newer after using this oil. The older one was hand made for me,the newer one store bought. Even though the older one had rarely been oiled,it looks almost like new and did not require as much oil as the newer one. very thrilled with results and used as directed
customer_reviews.author: Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after purchasing a new cutting board and wanted to protect it. Wow I received my bottle and applied it to my new board it was amazing. Then I applied it to every wooden thing in my kitchen. I feel better using my wooden kitchen things now that they are protected. The one thing I use this for that blew my mind was stainless steel. While on Pinterest someone suggested using on stainless steel appliances to reduce figure prints. Well my refrigerator was driving me crazy everyday I-had to clean them off. After using this Mineral oil on the refrigerator I have not had to clean prints off of it. That was about 3 weeks ago. AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: Twila Zizak

customer_reviews.title: Brought my old cutting board back to life!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a miracle if you have wooden cutting boards. If your cutting board has gotten really dry it may take a couple of times to finally get it to become water-resistant but just keep applying the oil. You can make a cutting board last for a really long time with this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Meegan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, No Shipping Problems
customer_reviews.text: Have always used this brand because it’s easy to use. I use it both as an oil cleanser and to oil my wood cutting boards and slate serving tray. I’m not sure if it leaks normally, or if I just tend to make a mess when I use it, but I can say it did not leak during shipping at all.
customer_reviews.author: cmriker

customer_reviews.title: 6 dollars more for a full gallon
customer_reviews.text: Not returnable and the price is not that good a deal considering you can get much much more for just a few bucks more.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Oiled up real nice
customer_reviews.text: I used this on several small wooden cutting boards I made and it worked really well. It really brought out the natural beauty of the wood. I noticed I brought out the grain of the lighter colored wood more. Applying coats periodically will be necessary to keep the boards in ideal condition. Great product and will use again, and again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Quantity and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who cooks, chops, cuts, and pounds.... all this on wooden boards which then must be washed and the oils replenished to maintain the board in tiptop shape... this is the oil to do just that! It's the right amount for optimum freshness and the perfect weight for great absorption.
customer_reviews.author: bocadelrio

customer_reviews.title: Great for greasy kitchen
customer_reviews.text: We cook a lot, a lot of stove work. The microwave and the cabinet above the stove is grease ocean This product made me very happy and I was able to wipe all the oil off the microwave and the cabinet with much less effort as I thought it would be, for each 2 spoonS of mineral oil use one cooking oil with clean cloth and you will see the magic. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Al Abdalah

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a butcher block. I noticed dry patches throughout the block after multiple washes. I didn’t realize that I needed to care for it. I did some research and came across this product. It was easy to apply and totally renewed my butcher block. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Janbeezy

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: This is a first time use, so I really didn't know what to expect. The product has very little to no smell and it soaked in nicely without running off of the cutting board. It has been a month and is holding up nicely. Makes a world of difference in wood/bamboo products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great on Cutting Boards
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on my cutting boards once a week. I clean them daily with Dawn/hot water and each Friday I use your Mineral Oil to treat the cutting boards. After treating, they soaked up the oil and looked like new (minus a few cut marks!) I like the snap top to drop oil onto the surface of cutting boards. A little goes a long way I have discovered. Great product, will be back for "refills"!
customer_reviews.author: BKC

customer_reviews.title: Cutting boards look great
customer_reviews.text: It really soaked into the wood. We bought relatively expensive, high-quality cutting boards close to 20 years ago & they held up well, but seemed dry. While this seems a bit expensive for "food grade" mineral oil, it is worth it. (I found similar available at WalMart for $4 less, but I have never shopped there & won't shop there, even to save $4.) I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rio Del Mar

customer_reviews.title: It’s quality mineral oil
customer_reviews.text: This oil seems to work great! It’s the first time I’ve used this brand. I used it on our cutting board, plus wooden utinsils. I followed the instructions and everything turned out nice. I like that it’s made in the U.S.A. That does help me trust the product more since it will be touching my food. Plus the U.S. has pretty strict standards. I’m very sure I’ll order this brand again next time I need it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Used to help clean a doggy spot
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased a new solid oak kitchen table. Doggy rebelled after we left and we had to clean a spot. The wood was damaged, milky spots. We lighted sanded with OOO steel wool and used the mineral oil to refinish. It was a perfect fix. We also plan to redo the table with the oil in leu of the rubbed wax. Thanks! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Jones

customer_reviews.title: Product Made In USA!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves to cook, and has multable wooden cutting boards, and wood utensils. Was looking for a high quality, food grade mineral oil that was made in the USA. this product fits all criteria. Upon receiving product, I treated all wooden utensils, and cutting boards. Excellent oil. Went on and absorbed easily. Everything looks new again. Thank you for a great product, and rest assured, I will be purchasing again when I run low. JD
customer_reviews.author: classic

customer_reviews.title: I found this product easy to use and apply
customer_reviews.text: I found this product easy to use and apply. It gives the board a great shine, without being too greasy, scenty or going rancid like Olive Oil. The only reason not for 5 stars is that it takes an overnight dry instead of what the instructions on the bottle say it should take. If you don't mind the extra time for it to soak in, I would definitely get this, in fact, this is now my go to for all my boards.
customer_reviews.author: Spacegirl

customer_reviews.title: The product does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: The food-grade mineral works quite well. I like the results. If I were going to say anything negative it would be the dispenser. I once had a bottle of food-grade mineral oil that had a sponge dabber on top that came with a (wood-handled) knife set that I own. That made it easier to apply the oil to the surface I wanted to treat. With saying that, a bamboo cutting board (which I purchased the oil for) is a much larger surface. The sponge dabber for that purpose might be a bit of a pain. But, I could always remove the cover and pour it on the surface ;).
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mineral oil to use on my new Amana cutting boards. Very easy to use - just rub on layer. Will update this review if things change but right now results are beautiful. FYI - No smell, just a non-greasy oil. Rubbed it into wood with hands. Residue was very light on my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Pammycats

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: The butcher block Top of my kitchen island was looking pretty dry...I had run out of the treatment oil I usually put on it, and I’ve been scrubbing the top and using food-safe disinfectant spray more than usual since the pandemic began. I applied the food grade mineral oil And left it on for about twenty hours, then buffed the top of the island. Very happy with the results...the wood is once again well-conditioned.
customer_reviews.author: sandyk

customer_reviews.title: Cheese Board for the WIN
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product!!! I wanted to create a giant cheese board/platter so I went to the hardware store and purchased a 4'x3' board. I then oiled the board with this mineral oil. Apply generously and use rubber or plastic gloves. I applied twice and allowed plenty of time to dry. The cheese board was such a hit at my party!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had a cutting board that hadn't been oiled in a year. I liberally applied a coating of this oil and left it overnight. The next morning the board had absorbed the oil and was like new. Highly recommend using this brand.
customer_reviews.author: chappytrails
